MR CERVICAL SPINE

HISTORY: Motor vehicle accident with normal cervical spine CT.
Rule out ligamentous injury.

Sagittal imaging was performed with long TR, long TE fast spin
echo, short TR, short TE spin echo, and STIR technique. Axial
long TR, long TE fast spin echo, and gradient echo imaging was
performed. Comparison to a cervical spine CT of [**2155-4-12**].

FINDINGS: The study is limited by motion artifact. There are
degenerative changes, most marked at C4-5 with canal narrowing
and probable encroachment on the spinal cord, although this is
poorly evaluated due to motion. The study is of limited
reliability for detecting ligamentous injury. No definite
ligamentous tears are detected. However, there is a small amount
of tissue edema or fluid anterior to the C3 through C5 vertebral
bodies. This may represent hemorrhage, perhaps suggesting a
ligamentous compromise. If there is clinical suspicion of
ligamentous injury, a follow up MR examination may be helpful.
